title: Bail, etc., before judgment
context: §660-28 Bail, etc., before judgment. Except as otherwise provided: (1) Until judgment is given, the court may remand the party or accept bail for the party&rsquo;s appearance from day to day or may place the party under special care and custody, as circumstances may require; and (2) After judgment is given, an order made by the court under paragraph (1) shall be continued in effect during a stay of enforcement of judgment, unless the trial court, the intermediate appellate court, or the supreme court after taking of the appeal, terminates the order or makes other provision in the circumstances. Pending return, custody of petitioner remains undisturbed. 26 H. 363, 367 (1922). After judgment and pending perfection of appeal, authority over custody of child. 26 H. 701 (1923).
